required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ARX788 in Breast Cancer With Low Expression of HER2
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-arm, Single-center Phase II Clinical Study of Recombinant Humanized Anti-HER2 Monoclonal Antibody-AS269 Conjugate (ARX788) in the Treatment of Unresectable and/or Metastatic Breast Cancer With Low Expression of HER2

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase 2 Study of ARX788 in unresectable and/or metastatic breast cancer with low expression of HER2.

detailed_description.textblock: A single arm, phase 2 study of ARX788 in unresectable and/or metastatic breast cancer with low expression of HER2. Subjects should received ≥2 lines of systemic chemotherapy regimens for recurrent or metastatic disease, and for HR positive subjects, also need to have received ≥2-line endocrine therapy ± targeted therapy (including neoadjuvant/adjuvant therapy). HER2 low expression is defined as HER2 IHC 1+ or HER2 IHC 2+ and FISH negative. The ARX788 will be administered every 3 weeks (Q3W) intravenous (IV) infusion.

primary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the percentage of subjects who have achieved complete response and partial response according RECIST 1.1

secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time between date of first dose of study therapy and date of progression or death, whichever occurs first, will be computed for response evaluable subjects. Subjects will be censored at time of subsequent therapy

Overall survival (OS) is defined as the time from first dose of study therapy to the date of death (any cause). Subjects who are alive will be censored at the last known time that the subject was alive
Disease control rate (DCR) is defined as cases where objective remission (assessed as complete remission or partial remission according to RECIST 1.1 standard) or stable disease during the study
DOR is defined as the time from the first documented objective response (CR or PR) to the first documented disease progression or death

clinical_study.condition: Breast Cancer With Low Expression of HER2

intervention.description: 1.5 mgkg IV infusion on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle.
